txt.en: 'Come with me.'
'If we are to remake this city...'
'...brighter and better than ever before...'
'...we must start with one of its darkest places.'
Speak with Khôltekh about Inîk Jewel-brow
'The Umbar-môkh, the Undercity.'
'As you heard, I have recently brought much of our fighting force below ground...'
Listen to the conversation between Khôltekh and Inîk Jewel-brow
'What a pleasant surprise!'
'Inîk Jewel-brow, Hall-father of Thargushakâl, the Shoreward Stone...'
'I intend to purge Umbar Baharbêl of its shadows, wherever they may hide. Will you help me, [placeholder]?’
'...has graced my humble manor with his presence.'
'To what do I owe this illustrious honour?'
'What are they defending exactly, Hall-father?'
'Thanks to my relations with the Men, we control our own fate in Umbar.'
Speak with Khôltekh about his plans for the Umbar-môkh.
'...much to the consternation of some. Why?'
'We have nothing to fear in Umbar.'
'Because I believe we need to bring the peace and prosperity you see above ground to our counterparts below.'
'We are Umbar.'
'The Umbar-môkh is a troubled place, filled with dangers both unseen and seen.'
'I understand, Hall-father.'
Khôltekh has taken you into his trust, for now. He's asked you to accompany him to his house to speak more about his plans for Umbar.
'We Temámir need to be a light in that shadow, bringing order and law to this lawless place.'
'There is much that moves in that shadow, [placeholder].'
'I have been tracking the movements of the Umbar-môkh...'
'...since before I became a Kindred of the Coins.'
'Bandits are more prevalent on the roads,'
'I know, because you won't let me forget it.'
'attacks on citizens more frequent...'
Listen to Khôltekh explain his plans for the Umbar-môkh, then cheer with him
'Very well - they stay there for now.'
'...and ships both Corsair and merchant are being waylaid...'
'But any other changes come through me, Khôltekh.'
'I'm not a dwarf you want to anger.'
'When we appointed you our representative...'
'...it was because you deal well with the Men around these walls.'
Introduce yourself to the important-looking dwarf standing in Khôltekh's entry room.
'Do not forget - you aren't one.'
Speak with Khôltekh about Inîk Jewel-brow.
'That went well. I expected much worse. Come with me.'
Listen to the conversation between Khôltekh and Inîk Jewel-brow.
Listen to Khôltekh explain his plans for the Umbar-môkh.
Listen to Khôltekh explain his plans for the Umbar-môkh.
'Khôltekh!'
'Khôltekh! You know full well why I am here.'
'Where are my fighting guards?'
'Where is the force that is supposed to be protecting Thargushakâl?'
'I am still Hall-father.'
'I still command the Dwarves of the Shoreward Stone.'
'Do not get that twisted, just because you are on some council of Men.'
'It is my word that binds.'
'Your tongue may be silver, but mine is iron.'
'...their treasure and cargo seized.'
'There are many shadows in the Umbar-môkh.'
'But there is one shadow darker than the rest.'
'One name that seems to control much of the banditry...'
'...thievery and murder, both below and above in Umbar Baharbêl.'
'I have met many who only whisper his name.'
'He is simply called Sêkhta. It means 'blight'.'
'And that is exactly what he is.'
'A blight upon my city.'
'I intend to purge Umbar Baharbêl of its shadows, wherever they may hide.'
Listen to Khôltekh explain his plans for the Umbar-môkh
Speak with Khôltekh about his plans for the Umbar-môkh
Listen to Khôltekh explain his plans for the Umbar-môkh
'However, I need those guards where they are, in the Umbar-môkh.'
An Audience with the Hall-father
'It is very important for our relations with the Men.'
'My relations have been very good for our coffers. I think you'd agree.'
Introduce yourself to the important-looking dwarf standing in Khôltekh's entry room
'Of course, Hall-father.'
